definition: bit (of a bridle)/to hold in the mouth/to harbor (feelings)/to link/to accept/rank/title
step with the left foot (Kangxi radical 60)/see also 彳亍[chi4 chu4]
step with the right foot/see 彳亍[chi4 chu4]
leading (role)/heading list of signatories/leading actors (in a show)/starring
the swallow's nest is built one beakful of mud at a time (idiom)/many a little makes a mickle
pinyin: yan4 zi5 xian2 ni2 lei3 da4 wo1

sentences.english: He had a pipe in his mouth and was smoking.
sentences.chinese: 他嘴里衔一个烟斗，正吸着烟。

sentences.english: The falcon carried the sword to the palace rooftop and dropped it as it flew over a statue.
sentences.chinese: 秃鹰衔着剑飞上皇宫的屋顶，越过了一座雕像。

sentences.english: Two dogs strive for a bone, the third runs away with it.
sentences.chinese: 二狗相争一骨头，第三只狗衔起走。

sentences.english: The rolled cigarette between his teeth completed the picture as he used the door knocker.
sentences.chinese: 像往常那样，他衔着卷烟，拍打了一下门环。

sentences.english: His parents worked hard bringing food to the nest, feeding him from their beaks.
sentences.chinese: 父母辛勤觅食回巢，以嘴衔食喂它。

sentences.chinese: 手与口衔的接触应该要独立于骑手的骑坐之外。

sentences.english: The main contact with the horse's mouth must be through the snaffle bit.

sentences.english: It'll fetch things when you throw them .

sentences.english: One man , wearing a red cap and with a knife in his mouth , was already on top of the fence .
sentences.chinese: 其中一个戴着红帽子，嘴里衔着刀的人正在围栏上。

sentences.english: My family, but the fifth title South Ning Prefecture Longan teachings of Zhu Yunying's mother.
sentences.chinese: 尔谢氏，乃五品衔南宁府隆安县教谕朱允煐之母。

sentences.english: You set a goal of attaining the highest pin qualification as soon as you started Amway business. Why?
sentences.chinese: 为甚么你一开始参加安利便订下最高奖衔的目标？

sentences.english: He has several honorary professorships from China.
sentences.chinese: 他还获中国多所大学荣誉教授衔。

sentences.english: A crow who had stolen a piece of meat, perched in a tree.
sentences.chinese: 有一只乌鸦偷到一块肉，衔着站在大树上。

definition: cap badge (official sign of rank in Qing dynasty)
tutor to the crown prince (in imperial China)
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
the local commander/provincial governor (in Qing and Ming times)
